result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony H Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

It is hereby ordered that the Def is terminated from BMP and cash bail is reinstated in the amount of $6,000 per case with BMP removed as a condition of bond. All other bail conditions remain set.

Atty Khandhar wanted ct to address BMP violations that defn. has had recently.  ADA Moese made argument that if more violations the State will move to have him terminated from BMP.  Ct. had discussion w/defn. about seriousness of BMP violations and consequences if continues.  Atty Khandhar asked for set over of trial due to just getting discovery.  Ct. will set over and reschedule trial dates.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM). If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $6,000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.
